meanings.definition: To make more dense or compact.
meanings.sent1: I will condense the clothes in the suitcase to make more space.
meanings.sent2: The chef will condense the sauce by simmering it for a longer time.
meanings.sent3: Trying to condense all my belongings into one bag was a challenge.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts seemed to condense into a single clear idea.
meanings.sent5: The fog began to condense into droplets on the window, obscuring the view.

meanings.definition: To reduce in volume or size.
meanings.sent1: Please condense the essay to fit within the word limit.
meanings.sent2: The company decided to condense the packaging to save on materials.
meanings.sent3: I tried to condense my speech, but I still went over the time limit.
meanings.sent4: The artist managed to condense a whole story into a single painting.
meanings.sent5: The heat caused the steam to condense into water droplets on the cold glass.

meanings.definition: To concentrate or make more intense.
meanings.sent1: Let's condense our efforts on finishing this project by the end of the week.
meanings.sent2: The speaker tried to condense her message to make it more impactful.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's jokes seemed to condense into one hilarious punchline.
meanings.sent4: The tension in the room seemed to condense into a palpable energy.
meanings.sent5: The emotions in the room began to condense into a shared feeling of excitement.
